thread.title: David Beckham posts emotional tribute to Bobby Charlton after he sees Manchester United goal-record broken by Wayne Rooney
thread.title_full: David Beckham posts emotional tribute to Bobby Charlton after he sees Manchester United goal-record broken by Wayne Rooney

author: dfraser
title: David Beckham posts emotional tribute to Bobby Charlton after he sees Manchester United goal-record broken by Wayne Rooney
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments DAVID BECKHAM has paid an emotional tribute to Sir Bobby Charlton after he watched his Manchester United goal-scoring record broken by Wayne Rooney. 
Former Everton man Roo, 31, netted a superb 94th-minute free-kick to equalise against Stoke on Saturday evening to hit the magic 250-mark. Getty Images Wayne Rooney’s free-kick broke Sir Bobby Charlton’s record on Saturday 
In doing so, Rooney has now overtaken Charlton as leading goal-scorer for both England and United. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
On his Instagram Beckham posted a picture of himself meeting his idol as a youngster, and captioned it: “40 years Sir Bobby has had the goal scoring record at Manchester United that proves how difficult it was to beat. 
“Today Wayne beat that record and Sir Bobby has been sat in the stand every game to be there when this happened. Wayne Rooney breaks Sir Bobby Charlton’s Manchester United goalscoring record Instagram David Beckham posted a photo of himself with Sir Bobby Charlton after Wayne Rooney's goal 
"What a gentleman, player and true United legend. 
"Well done Sir Bobby and congratulations to Wayne”. 
Following the record-breaking strike from Rooney, Charlton was honest and humble, saying he is disappointed, yet happy. @ManUtd Wayne Rooney was congratulated by Sir Bobby Charlton on Saturday evening PA:Press Association Wayne Rooney finally broke the record with his sublime Stoke free-kick 
He said: “I’d be lying to say I’m not disappointed to lose the record. 
"However, I can honestly say I’m delighted for Wayne. He’s a true great for club and country. 
"It’s fitting he is now the highest goalscorer for both United and England.” Stoke 1-1 Manchester United : Rooney breaks Sir Bobby Charlton’s record
